info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 8:35PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A heavy rain producing thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fremont and northwestern Pueblo Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 834 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong heavy rain producing thunderstorm near Penrose, or 17 miles northeast of Junkins Burn Scar, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Fremont and northwestern Pueblo Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
